result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald W. Burchfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald W. Burchfield is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donald W. Burchfield was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: On or Near a School, Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.   Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
++ Pay fine of $900.00   and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Do not associate with people who do drugs.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION.  Huber allowed.  49 days credit.Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  The court withholds sentence and defendant is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions  The court orders 9 months conditional jail with credit for 49 days served commencing 9/24/16 @ 8:00 a.m., huber privileges are allowed.  The court imposes $900.00 fine plus court costs as a condition of probation; bond applied, any remainder to be returned to poster.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay a $250.00 surcharge; written notice provided to defendant.
No appearance by Atty Terry Rose due to a lengthy hearing in another court today so Sentencing has been rescheduled to 9/13/16 at 10:30 AM.
Sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Donald W. Burchfield, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.   Clerk: PT 
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In.  Counts 3, 4 and 5 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Parties mutually request one final adjournment as they expect case to be resolved.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 09:40 am.
